content: lizard ridge coasters this pattern makes a set of 4 coasters gauge approximately 4 stitches per inch in garter stitch before felting gauge is not critical but will affect yardage needed and the size of your coasters for felting purposes it s best if your knit fabric is just a bit on the loose side measurements each coaster is approximately 4 inches square but will vary with the amount of felting and trimming materials  1 skein of noro kureyon or about 110 yards of any feltable yarn in at least two colors  us 8/5mm needles or whatever size you need to get a fairly loose fabric in garter stitch  means for felting the square  rotary cutter and mat or very sharp scissors notes  there s no need for your short row to be invisible felting will hide them  you do not need to pick up the wraps  if you are using several colors instead of one skein of kureyon or something else with long color runs change colors on row 6 and 12 for planned color changes although you can change colors anywhere abbreviations repeat instructions inside brackets specified number of times k knit w&t wrap and turn slip the next stitch to the right needle move the working yarn to the front of your work return the slipped stitch to the left needle turn your work in preparation for knitting back toward the beginning of the row lizard ridge coasters ©2015 by laura aylor all rights reserved page 1 instructions cast on 43 stitches using the long-tail cast-on knit 3 row then begin 12-row pattern below row 1-3 knit row 4 k12 w&t k8 w&t k7 w&t k6 w&t k5 w&t k4 w&t k20 2 times w&t k8 w&t k7 w&t k6 w&t k5 w&t k4 w&t k9 row 5-9 knit row 10 k5 w&t k5 turn k4 w&t k4 turn k19 w&t k8 w&t k7 w&t k6 w&t k5 w&t k4 w&t k20 w&t k8 w&t k7 w&t k6 w&t k5 w&t k4 w&t k16 then at end of row turn k5 w&t k5 turn k4 w&t k4 row 11 and 12 knit work row 1-12 four times total knit 3 more row and bind off felt your square flatten it out and let dry techknitter has some great info on felting here - http //techknitting blogspot com/2011/11/felting-primer-for-hand-knits html using a rotary cutter and mat or very sharp scissors trim around all 4 sides of the felted square to neaten the edges and make the corners square then cut the trimmed square into quarters you can see photos of this process on my blog http //tossingthestash blogspot com/2015/11/quick-gift html pattern support email laylor13@gmail com ravelry group http //www ravelry com/groups/lauras-workshop ravelry shop http //www ravelry com/designers/laura-aylor lizard ridge coasters ©2015 by laura aylor all rights reserved page 2
